desc: "...an effective guide for Unix developers who want accurate information specifically on getting up to speed with Mac OS X and its software development environment, without having to sort through the morass of online information overload. ...If you've been a little skittish about Interface Builder, forget your worries now because the tutorial in the book is very good. ...The projects and examples are thorough and should provide even the most jaded intermediate programmer with a real taste of how challenging and satisfying it can be to code for OSX." - KickStartNews.com
title: Programming Mac OS X
